intro: Navarretia miwukensis, commonly known as the Miwuk's navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its small, white or pale pink flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Navarretia miwukensis is adapted to dry environments and is often found in areas with well-drained soil.
